title: Sonoma Valley
name: Annadel State Park
directions: east of Santa Rosa and south of Highway 12 on Channel Drive via Montgomery Drive
content: On the northern side of Sonoma Valley, just south of Santa Rosa, Annadel State Park is a 5,092 acre state owned property. Former residence to the Wappo and Pomo people, the park has geological and biological importance. The world's finest example of northern oak woodlands is located here, and wildflowers bring out quite the crowd in the spring. The park surrounds Lake Ilsanjo, which also offers fishing for bass and bluegill.
